snippet: Mr. Granger, who was once a Chicago newspaperman, also wrote more than a score of mysteries and spy thrillers, many of which evoked the rougher environs of Chicago.
abstract: Bill Granger, journalist turned novelist, dies at age 70. Photo (M)1
lead_paragraph: Bill Granger, a newspaperman turned novelist whose fiction alternated between international spy thrillers and police procedurals set on the gritty streets of Chicago -- and occasionally blended both -- died on April 22 at a veterans home in Manteno, Ill. He was 70. The cause was heart failure, his wife, Lori Granger, said, adding that he had been incapacitated since a series of strokes in the 1990s.

headline.main: Bill Granger, 70, Journalist Turned Author of Fiction
